intro: Pseudocymopterus longiradiatus, commonly known as the long-rayed cymopterus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has pinnately divided leaves that are covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is native to regions of western North America, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid climates.
